title: How can Android Backup break your app
description:
One of the most significant changes introduced in Android 6.0 is Android Backup - a standarized mechanism for backuping apps' data. However, backup is not a new concept on Android - we had third party solutions there for years. What can we learn from them? What should be your strategy for backuping data? Is your app ready to handle database migrations properly, and handle old, no-longer-supported SharedPreferences' keys?

Attend my talk to learn:
- How Android Backup works in general
- How old-fashioned backup tools broke my app in the past
- How to prevent such defects in Android Backup

title: Planning Android Screens
description: This talks is about Android UX when building new screen from scratch. We will go through some common Android screens (like Login / Sign Up / Search / etc.) and see what issues you can face, how popular apps are solving them and what are our options. At the end I will show how to plan & prototype animations with Pixate Studio.

title: Power of Android Shell
description:
Android provides a set of not really well documented command line tools that are mainly used by system engineers for debugging and testing purposes. Available after entering 'adb shell', these tools can give you a lot of details about what is happening in the system and help with automation.

We'll see what is available in Android command line and
- analyze system and sample apps with 'dumpsys',
- find out how to check whether your service finishes normally and does not live forever,
- mock battery level and charger state,
- trigger account sychronization,
- change system settings without a single line of UiAutomator code.

title: Hijacking notification actions - lets respond to your messages!
description:
Always wanted to implement automatic answer to your text messages/FB Messenger/Telegram and didn't want to implement whole client for this?

Wanted to call some action in any notification from your app without too much permissions (or root access)?

Here we go! I will show and explain how to hijack actions from any visible notification to any other app.

title: Angular2: Reasoning behind technical decisions
description: TBD

title: V8 under the hood
description: What is happening inside V8 javascript engine - optimization, work, etc.

title: Scalable Microservices with gRPC, Kubernetes, and Containers
description:
Microservices and Containers are a great mix, but if you want to get serious about using them together then you need to start shopping for a Cluster Management and Container Orchestration Platform. It just so happens there's already an extremely popular, Open Source, Cross Cloud Platform called Kubernetes. You'll also need something to wire them together, maybe something that offers high performance RPCs, but also provides a toolset to generate services and clients in multiple languages. gRPC is a language and platform-neutral RPC framework, based on HTTP/2 and Protobuf, used to build highly performant and scalable APIs.

In this talk, we’ll demo the core concepts of gRPC and Kubernetes, and show you how to combine these two technologies to create scalable and performant microservices rooted in lessons learned from Google’s experience!

title: Redefining PaaS: Managed container based apps on Google App Engine
description:
Are you building the next big idea? Are you part of a team that is focused on streamlined dev/test/production deployments? Are you a bit more “dev” than “ops”? If so, be sure to come by and check out this talk that focuses on maximizing developer productivity through the use of microservice based architectures and container technology in conjunction with Google App Engine.

We'll look at new and enhanced features of App Engine and walk through the staged deployment of both a simple application and a more complicated microservices based architecture. We'll also look at how App Engine has evolved from it's original sandboxed runtime environment to what it is today, a next generation platform for building and deploying modern day applications.

title: Android Studio 1.3 with C/C++
description: TBD

title: Material Design Magic
description:
1. Material Design Magic
2. Work with colours, typography and custom branding
3. Frameworks for MD Style
4. Issues, tricks and Best cases.

title: Continuous Delivery with Ease
description: Do you create builds for your client frequently? Maybe every day? That’s good, because you can get feedback early and often… unless you do that manually, pushing APKs via mail or to some app testing platform via browser. Look back at the time spent on these tedious tasks. How would you feel if you could spend less time and do even more at the same time? I will show you, how easy it is to set things up, not to spend even a minute a day to create builds for your testers. We will look at all the requirements for that and we will go as far as enabling business people to decide when to publish new version of your amazing application literally with a push of a button.

title: Let's play Dart!
description:
Dart is a language for the web by Google which is object oriented with optional types. You can use Dart to build great apps for the client-side, server-side and command line.

Come to listen to my story why I love Dart and why it makes me so much productive!

title: Polymer vs other libraries
description: Most modern front-end JavaScript libraries provide support for component based development. Components help separate large applications into standalone building blocks with specified communication API. Let's compare Polymer elements with components from React, Angular, Ember and Backbone.

title: Bluetooth Low Energy and iBeacon development for Android
description: iBeacon is a new technology created by Apple. iBeacon uses a Bluetooth low energy signal, which Android 4.3+ devices can detect. Some fairly significant improvements were announced at Google I/O 2014 for improved BLE support in Android Lollipop. We will discuss different implementations for devices prior to 5.0, and for 5.0 and higher.  During our talk you will learn how to implement background beacon scanning, how to improve battery life (and how to choose between fast beacon detection and longer battery life). Also we'll discuss, on how to turn your android device into multiple iBeacon transmitters. Allowing a single Android device to act as multiple iBeacons opens up a huge number of interesting possibilities.

title: Students & Google: how not to vanish in the crowd
description: Most students believe that getting a job at Google is some kind of 'Mission Impossible'. Fortunately, you don't need superpower for this. In her talk Anna will tell you about the opportunities for students at Google and will share some tips on how to apply, keep calm and succeed.

title: Android TV Development
description: We will discuss how to start programming for Android TV, what is “10 foot UI” and some hardware features  that Android TV developers should bear in mind.We will found out about the competitors and what is the current state of the market.

title: Firebase Adventures - Real time platform for your apps
description:
Firebase is a powerful platform for building mobile and web applications. Use Firebase to store and sync data instantly, authenticate users, and easily deploy your web app.

Firebase Adventures is a talk about how to use Firebase in different ways to give you the ability to build extraordinary cross-platform apps.

title: [Workshop] Getting started with Firebase
description: TBD

title: Service Worker - Native Apps Experience For The Web
description: Installing and updating apps, network interceptors and full cache management, push notifications and background updates. All these is now possible in Web apps with Service Worker! Even when the App is closed. Excited? Be the one to touch it first!

title: Google WebRTC on Mobile
description: WebRTC is a new milestone in the evolution of the web. This technology allows us to quickly create real-time communication applications. Altough its main target is web browsers, WebRTC is becoming a popular real time communication technology used on mobile. By using WebRTC you can develop your own peer-to-peer video chat in a short amount of time. Also, WebRTC is very flexible, you can make calls to another networks that using offer/answer model, for example SIP protocol. In this presentation you can gain in-depth insights about how to implement WebRTC on iOS and Android mobile devices for a native experience.

title: Build Your Thing In a Weekend with AngularJS 2.0
description: Have you ever had and idea that you abandon after some time? You are not alone. That’s true for most of the software projects. The reasons might vary, lack of time, scope of the thing you want to build, or simply losing interest after some time. If only there was some easier way to build your thing with less hassle. Actually there is. In this talk we will discuss how to do that with AngularJS 2.0. We will go through some of the basics and talk about how it might help you implement your idea and what it has to offer.

title: Keynote
description: TBD

title: Google Solve for X comes in Ukraine
description: TBD

title: Solving Dev / Test conflicts
description:
In the ideal world, developers and testers act as a single solid team with a common goal. In reality, there is a number of problems that can create a split between these leagues, and even start a tiny cold war.

We'll try to look into some tricky questions.
- How can we detect the split at the earliest stage?
- What can we do to prevent it?
- If we have already faced it, how can we heal it?

title: Material Design in Games
description: TBD

title: How to succeed in the kids and family mobile app space
description: Learn how successful kids and family app developers understand and engage their audiences, and how you can design high-quality apps just for this group. You'll also get practical tips to help you boost your reach, retention or revenue.

title: [Workshop] Let's build new Polymer application
description: Polymer is a great tool for prototyping new applications. In this workshop, you will see, how to build nice looking front-end application using Polymer Starter Kit and predefined set of elements and components. We're going to use backend API from Dart code lab. Feel free to visit both workshops, but you can also attend Dart or Polymer workshops individually. Note: please don't forget to bring your laptop and download Polymer Starter Kit (https://developers.google.com/web/tools/polymer-starter-kit/).

title: [Workshop] Dart in the Could
description: TBD
